FE9C78DBB4D845FC83E76E885F2CB748.description: Explain features of communication, showing awareness of the impact of accommodating different purposes and contexts.

F075C322FF9044DAA1663772ABDF13D5.description: Evaluate own and others' talk, including giving constructive feedback.

864BF7CE996D42BCBA4950BFE5965B57.description: Plan and deliver a persuasive speech in a familiar context.

A71871187A79435B93B67CF0334FECC1.description: Plan and deliver presentations confidently in a range of contexts, making choices about the most appropriate media.

00EF532918CF42C981C3E94DA1DFA2FE.description: Show insight into texts and issues through choice of speech, gesture and movement, within drama.

3B676FB1AA2F48AC80E62E8321C8FE85.description: Show evidence of reading ahead when reading an unseen text aloud.

EB05E3BECB3A4FE78E2F0243A680B8E5.description: Read aloud with confidence, accuracy and style.

7AB4615D0D0C434E953A3FE48852DD3D.description: Be sensitive to others when turn-taking, ensuring that the intended outcome of the discussion is achieved.

3A537BF033F14750AB35C80501761051.description: Summarise and develop a discussion, responding sensitively to the range of ideas.

69C7968C07E446B2BCBDB214603CD76E.description: Identify points of agreement and disagreement in opposing points of view.

D637BC3D5BD2422B90A28F1C0315BADD.description: Independently identify and take up group roles as needed, and demonstrate expertise.

F45230711ADD45A98F6C01D166A5A32E.description: Listen, analyse what is heard, and give a reasoned response that draws on a range of sources.

74BB4CED7D7E4BDDAE90BCECEFC5CADD.description: Adapt communication to create appropriate impact on different audiences.

B159529BEEA44180A8054B1AECE42253.description: Use non-verbal communication techniques to enhance meaning.

47B7BD5C6E1D4AD999894EC2B9C33B0C.description: Use language to express concrete and abstract ideas and opinions in detail.

55C7DF7985D54CE7AC3F63E3E7531918.description: Shape talk for clarity and effect, and to engage the listener, in a range of familiar contexts.

129EF26CF0F5495D9227657390D1D0B6.description: Adapt speech, including length, pace and tone, in a range of contexts, showing some awareness of its impact.

922A0BFD17764D32A9A2F15E2C07F708.description: Evaluate and edit to improve the accuracy and effectiveness of language, grammar and structure of own and others' writing.

DE5D1A102F5D4F67B531D99F7B952983.description: Use different layouts and presentation in a variety of texts (handwritten, printed and onscreen).

D3E1C3A8A0CF4A58BD6FE25EBB519BA6.description: Use different ways of note-taking when writing for different purposes and use notes to inform writing.

46689AE7798B40ADAC6398B59BF2C1F7.description: Sustain a fast, fluent and legible handwriting style.

CCA3B22252C9427EA09FB535E7654C09.description: Begin to develop distinctive voices, both personal and for different characters.

E1D7F146B3B346139B6CD9B64E2B43A7.description: Write to express a personal viewpoint in fiction and non-fiction writing.

170ECF6736324127B332495BA33DDECE.description: Create content to suit a specified audience.

9C081CF807F14D25A4E4B077B37591A7.description: Use relevant features when writing for a chosen purpose.

A0161EB186ED442BB596FAD965DCA758.description: Use a range of planning methods to generate, organise and shape ideas.

711CB8642D2A456A9D3891C885DFD5F4.description: Write confidently in a range of different genres of fiction and types of poems.

18A56772F0AD4A27AFA89E9EE20E40D0.description: Use appropriate connectives and sentence openings to clarify connections in writing, e.g. connectives for comparison, sequencing, qualifying.

DD324248635B40E28A98322413E412E0.description: Use a range of organisational features accurately to link ideas, and clarify and extend meaning.

32DEC035B042434AAD8D44C7F3299ED3.description: Shape the overall structure and sequence of a chosen text to convey the intended purpose accurately.

CCA1D2D63EB3412DB55294BE71F7115F.description: Use formal and informal registers appropriately according to context, purpose and audience.

2DAD9B18F36D43A3A94DA76C262DD572.description: Use the conventions of standard English consistently in writing.

41D1D24AA715451CB88FAB04B616314C.description: Build up detail through the grammatical structure of sentences, e.g. expanding verb phrases.

D8E3A6213E1046739EABAED937DBD32F.description: Use simple, compound, complex and compound-complex sentences accurately, in a variety of sentence types, to communicate meaning.

EF33BDE7B8FC497387F6E0337F3B2077.description: Use a range of punctuation accurately to clarify meaning in sentences and dialogue.

D6A032828B6A48EA843AC38C6BDFAF15.description: Use ellipses, colons, semi-colons, dashes and hyphens, including hyphens for compound adjectives.

35CDBB7EE8E44BC087D9BF3578204B21.description: Use a range of sources to develop and extend the range of language used in written work.

E9DED0B996D94FE4AACAA5395D758927.description: Create an effect by using key linguistic and literary techniques.

97C07182CD1C493EBF688BEA78D2C448.description: Use language precisely to clarify and extend intended meaning.

5196D82AF9D84EC0909A2A74C33F536C.description: Use relevant strategies for spelling correctly.

8458493E85CA4698AD103016A3868594.description: Show understanding of word families, roots, derivations and morphology in spelling.

50AE64C52C894A8C8EE7BEDC0AC2F9C9.description: Use known spelling patterns to correctly spell most commonly used words.

1D747F525FA343BDADD75D8DB4D51241.description: Comment on the different ways texts can reflect the social, cultural and historical contexts in which they were written.

7701C809C4AB448CA657697C9EDB72C5.description: Discuss how readers make choices about which texts to read.

C570A749A0134586B83232E6BAC87218.description: Experiment with the choice of books read, including choosing writers or genres which compare or contrast with previous reading.

AABEA513346F4554A3AAD4D3A709CDC7.description: Express personal responses to texts, including preferences and opinions, referring back to specific content.

E581613712F448DCBB8E3C0E46BC0085.description: Enjoy reading a wide range of texts.

E9F5C93CB3EE4C53B5E58596DFC53E88.description: Show understanding of how writers create a distinctive voice.

AA771CB844B04128A575BBD3C9C9DD75.description: Identify and comment on the main ideas, viewpoints and purposes in a text.

9443EB5404B44BDFA33FCD1101068027.description: Begin to discuss how a writer combines different structural, linguistic and literary features for effect.

1452E123D47C41179634D767E5F1F358.description: Comment on the different ways in which writers convey theme and the impact on the reader.

FF2F3C56FE884201A24B256FDA4C5837.description: Support and inform personal and critical responses to texts with relevant textual references.

4AE8A94BA03040FF8C7BDAA537758F32.description: Use a range of reading strategies to extract relevant information from a text, including annotation.

C25BE58EF0254924B04092C922C32A76.description: Collate and summarise ideas and information from a text.

814C543118A443D4971D9DA0A636D030.description: Use inference and deduction to recognise and explain implicit meanings.

15A91C99B9694D6E8F8A9C202B159BD7.description: Identify and explain the meaning of explicit information from a range of texts.

5A1DCD631DFD4F33BC2EDE64CAEEE9A4.description: Read and discuss a range of non-fiction text types.

B7BCCEDB71494D95949D463DD4566892.description: Read and discuss a range of fiction genres, poems and playscripts, including the contribution of any visual elements or multimedia.

11CEC7D4CFF44FE58FAE80AB92E69293.description: Comment on the impact of a writer's choice of connectives and sentence openings on the intended purpose and audience.

CBBEB824DC23489CBA5A4C27BC5B78BE.description: Identify and comment on the variety of ways in which the content of texts can be organised and linked to support the intended purpose, including paragraphs.

F43BD2A5AE4D45469CEAFE9A5A830D10.description: Comment on the key features of text structure in a range of fiction and non-fiction texts, including poetic forms.

8676D291F56843AF9304BAA0937EE1A1.description: Identify differences between formal and informal language.

617258A1110E49D887929218F83454B2.description: Comment on the ways in which a writer uses non-standard English.

22ACED8223F54C89943C30AF0151AE27.description: Comment on how a writer builds up detail through the grammatical structure of their sentences.

99B8AA0E96B14099885FE6729B3C2D4A.description: Show awareness of reasons for using simple, compound, complex and compound-complex sentences.

D62CD4025A0D4AB9890F4CA11B231A9D.description: Comment on the use of punctuation to create effects, e.g. using an ellipsis to show a cliffhanger.

3CC7C3E2360441998F44F5BD4B7B8C99.description: Describe how linguistic and literary techniques are used to create effects in a specific context, and use accurate terminology, e.g. using terms such as assonance or sibilance to differentiate between types of phonetic repetition.

8315F72D12AE4EB6876C2148B5648326.description: Comment on a writer’s choice of language, demonstrating an understanding of the impact on the reader.

F0DAA2415E014587947AB0C0A042183F.description: Deduce the meanings of unfamiliar words in context using a range of strategies, including knowledge of word families, etymology and morphology.

8DC20744DB05467E9E4EC802A700545A.description: This sub-strand appears only in the primary curriculum.
